data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you always take the same steps. Whenever you are facing left, you take 9 steps left. Whenever you are facing right, you take 9 steps right. If you always face right, you take 10 steps straight. The answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you return to the starting point in 4 steps, you get to start it from scratch. In the same sentence, the first step says take 4 steps. To recirculate you’ll have to take 4 steps. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
No you can't return to the starting point by turning around and taking 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

You can complete this sequence in 7 steps. To complete the sequence, you need to count: 7 steps - 1 step = 7 steps. Again, to complete the sequence, you need to count: 7 steps - 1 step = 7 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you were taking 2 steps backwards, you would take 2 steps back in the reverse of where you left off. Thus, the answer is No.

You will always face forward. To take 1 step left, you must first take 3 steps. To take 4 steps in one direction, you must first take 4 steps to the right. So, the answer is yes.

You should always face forward. If you take 4 steps left, you will always take 4 more steps left. Similarly, if you take 3 steps forward, you will always take 3 more steps forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 6 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To take 9 steps forward, you start by taking 5 steps right. The order is: 1) You begin with 9 steps forward (at right), 2) You started with 4 steps backwards (at left), 3) You started with 5 steps left (at right), 4) You started with 9 steps forward (at left), 5) You started with 1 step forward (at right), 6) You started with 3 steps right. If you only take the order given, you never take two steps at the same time. In general the order is: 1) Take each step, 2) Take each one at a different time, 3) Take each one at a different time, 4) Repeat until you have gone back to where you started; thus, you always start with a backwards direction. Thus, the answer is Yes.
